_glossary.title: Glossary
_glossary.description: Select here to view the glossary for this course

_glossaryItems.description: drug that binds to the receptor and stimulates its function
accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity (abdomen), can be due to several causes including obstructed blood flow to the liver and cirrhosis

swelling of cells typically seen in microscopic examination; ballooning of hepatocytes (liver cells) denotes cell degeneration characterized by swelling and enlargement as found in steatohepatitis due to NASH/MASH
taking place at the same time as something else
ultrasound-based noninvasive tool used to assess liver fat

protein that binds with phospholipids on foreign substances and activates the immune system; stimulates the production of inflammatory molecules such as cytokines; elevated blood levels of CRP are found in many infectious and inflammatory diseases
repair and replacement of inflamed cells by connective tissue cells (fibroblasts), eventually resulting in replacement of normal organ tissue by scar tissue
hormone secreted by the pancreas that increases blood glucose by stimulating the liver to convert stored glycogen into glucose; it opposes the action of insulin
long-term measure of blood glucose control
brain dysfunction in patients with chronic liver disease and portal hypertension due to failure of the liver to detoxify the blood; may result in cognitive impairment and coma
one of several peptide hormones produced in the small intestine or colon in response to glucose; it stimulates secretion of insulin and inhibits secretion of glucagon

any of the conjugated chemicals in the bloodstream consisting of simple proteins bound to fat; cholesterol, phospholipids, and triglycerides are all fatty components of lipoproteins; lipoproteins are classified by their degree of density
oral drug in the thiazolidinedione class used as an adjunct to diet and exercise for management of type 2 diabetes

Medical Outcomes Study 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey; tool that measures perceived health status in 8 domains that include responses on physical, social, pain, mental health, emotional, vitality, and general health
deposition of fat in the liver
abnormal accumulation of fat inside cells or organs, common in obesity and type 2 diabetes
noninvasive measure of liver stiffness, measured by a device marketed as FibroScan<sup>Â®</sup>; elasticity of the liver is closely associated with the degree of fibrosis
pertaining to a varix, a twisting dilatation of a blood vessel (vein)
